question: What is the main challenge in real-time solutions of the optimal power flow (OPF) problem in electricity markets, and how do existing machine learning (ML) approaches address this challenge?
answer: The main challenge in real-time solutions of the OPF problem is the variability of renewable generation, which poses a challenge in traditional iterative methods. Existing ML approaches have focused on identifying active constraints, finding a warm start for iterative OPF solutions, or addressing the feasibility issue, but they rely on end-to-end neural networks that incur high model and computation complexity and need to be constantly re-trained whenever the system inputs change.
